trans-unit.source: Build a web app with Python and Flask using DocumentDB | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Build a web app with Python and Flask using DocumentDB | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use DocumentDB to store and access data from an Python and Flask (MVC) web application hosted on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use DocumentDB to store and access data from an Python and Flask (MVC) web application hosted on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Build a web application with Python and Flask (MVC) using DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: Build a web application with Python and Flask (MVC) using DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: To highlight how customers can efficiently leverage Azure DocumentDB to
trans-unit.target: To highlight how customers can efficiently leverage Azure DocumentDB to

trans-unit.source: store and query JSON documents, this document provides an end-to-end
trans-unit.target: store and query JSON documents, this document provides an end-to-end

trans-unit.source: tutorial showing how to build a voting web application using Azure DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: tutorial showing how to build a voting web application using Azure DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use the DocumentDB service provided by
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use the DocumentDB service provided by

trans-unit.source: Azure to store and access data from a Python web application hosted on
trans-unit.target: Azure to store and access data from a Python web application hosted on

trans-unit.source: Azure and presumes that you have some prior experience using Python and
trans-unit.target: Azure and presumes that you have some prior experience using Python and

trans-unit.source: Azure websites.
trans-unit.target: Azure websites.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial covers:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial covers:

trans-unit.source: Creating and provisioning a DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Creating and provisioning a DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Python MVC application.
trans-unit.target: Creating a Python MVC application.

trans-unit.source: Connecting to and using Azure DocumentDB from your web application.
trans-unit.target: Connecting to and using Azure DocumentDB from your web application.

trans-unit.source: Deploying the web application to Azure Websites.
trans-unit.target: Deploying the web application to Azure Websites.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple voting
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple voting

trans-unit.source: application that allows you to vote for a poll.
trans-unit.target: application that allows you to vote for a poll.

trans-unit.target: Screen shot of the todo list web application created by this tutorial

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before following the instructions in this article, you should ensure
trans-unit.target: Before following the instructions in this article, you should ensure

trans-unit.source: that you have the following installed:
trans-unit.target: that you have the following installed:

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio 2013](http://www.visualstudio.com/) or higher, or Visual Studio Express, which is the free version.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio 2013](http://www.visualstudio.com/) or higher, or Visual Studio Express, which is the free version.

trans-unit.source: Python Tools for Visual Studio from [here][].
trans-unit.target: Python Tools for Visual Studio from [here][].

trans-unit.source: Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013, version 2.4 or higher available from
trans-unit.target: Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013, version 2.4 or higher available from

trans-unit.source: [here][1].
trans-unit.target: [here][1].

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7 from [here][2].
trans-unit.target: Python 2.7 from [here][2].

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual C++ Compiler for Python 2.7 from [here][3].
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual C++ Compiler for Python 2.7 from [here][3].

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a DocumentDB database account
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a DocumentDB database account

trans-unit.source: Let's start by creating a DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Let's start by creating a DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: If you already have an account, you can skip to [Step 2: Create a new Python Flask web application](#Step-2:-Create-a-new-Python-Flask-Web-Application).
trans-unit.target: If you already have an account, you can skip to [Step 2: Create a new Python Flask web application](#Step-2:-Create-a-new-Python-Flask-Web-Application).

trans-unit.source: We will now walk through how to create a new Python Flask web application from the ground up.
trans-unit.target: We will now walk through how to create a new Python Flask web application from the ground up.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a new Python Flask web application
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a new Python Flask web application

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio, click **File** -\> **New Project** -\> **Python** -\>, **Flask Web Project**, and then create a new project with the name **tutorial**.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio, click **File** -\> **New Project** -\> **Python** -\>, **Flask Web Project**, and then create a new project with the name **tutorial**.

trans-unit.source: For those new to Flask, it is a web framework that helps us build web
trans-unit.target: For those new to Flask, it is a web framework that helps us build web

trans-unit.source: applications in Python faster.
trans-unit.target: applications in Python faster.

trans-unit.source: [Click here to access Flask tutorials][].
trans-unit.target: [Click here to access Flask tutorials][].

trans-unit.source: Screen shot of the New Project window in Visual Studio with Python highlighted on the left, Flask Web Project selected in the middle, and the name tutorial in the Name box
trans-unit.target: Screen shot of the New Project window in Visual Studio with Python highlighted on the left, Flask Web Project selected in the middle, and the name tutorial in the Name box

trans-unit.source: It will ask you whether you want to
trans-unit.target: It will ask you whether you want to

trans-unit.source: install external packages.
trans-unit.target: install external packages.

trans-unit.source: Click **Install into a virtual environment**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install into a virtual environment**.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to use Python 2.7 as the base environment because PyDocumentDB does not currently support Python 3.x.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to use Python 2.7 as the base environment because PyDocumentDB does not currently support Python 3.x.

trans-unit.source: This will set up the required Python virtual environment for your project.
trans-unit.target: This will set up the required Python virtual environment for your project.

trans-unit.source: Screen shot of the tutorial - Python Tools for Visual Studio window
trans-unit.target: Screen shot of the tutorial - Python Tools for Visual Studio window

trans-unit.target: Step 3: Modify the Python Flask web application

trans-unit.target: Add Flask packages to your project

trans-unit.source: After your project is set up, you need to add certain Flask packages that
trans-unit.target: After your project is set up, you need to add certain Flask packages that

trans-unit.source: you will need for your project, including pydocumentdb, the Python package for DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: you will need for your project, including pydocumentdb, the Python package for DocumentDB.

trans-unit.target: If

trans-unit.target: Sometimes the

trans-unit.source: Add a Python file by right-clicking the folder named **tutorial** in the Solution Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Add a Python file by right-clicking the folder named **tutorial** in the Solution Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Name the file **forms.py**.
trans-unit.target: Name the file **forms.py**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] The **CreateCollection** method takes an optional **RequestOptions** as the third parameter.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] The **CreateCollection** method takes an optional **RequestOptions** as the third parameter.

trans-unit.source: This can be used to specify the Offer Type for the collection.
trans-unit.target: This can be used to specify the Offer Type for the collection.

trans-unit.source: If no offerType value is supplied, then the collection will be created using the default Offer Type.
trans-unit.target: If no offerType value is supplied, then the collection will be created using the default Offer Type.

trans-unit.source: For more information on DocumentDB Offer Types, see [Performance levels in DocumentDB](documentdb-performance-levels.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on DocumentDB Offer Types, see [Performance levels in DocumentDB](documentdb-performance-levels.md).

trans-unit.target: Create the HTML files

trans-unit.target: Under the templates folder, add the following html files: create.html, results.html, vote.html.

trans-unit.target: Add the following code to **create.html**.

trans-unit.target: It takes care of displaying

trans-unit.target: It takes care of displaying the

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Deploy the application to Azure Websites
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Deploy the application to Azure Websites

trans-unit.target: Now that you have the complete application working correctly against

trans-unit.target: DocumentDB, we're going to deploy this to Azure Websites.

trans-unit.target: Right-click the project in Solution Explorer (make sure you're not still running it

trans-unit.target: Then, select **Microsoft Azure Websites**.
